issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Erasure Coding: need a way to test multiple EC policies

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.description:
TestDFSStripedInputStreamWithRandomECPolicy#testPreadWithDNFailure fails on trunk:


{code}
Running org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestDFSStripedInputStreamWithRandomECPolicy
Tests run: 5, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 10.99 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestDFSStripedInputStreamWithRandomECPolicy
testPreadWithDNFailure(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestDFSStripedInputStreamWithRandomECPolicy)  Time elapsed: 1.265 sec  <<< FAILURE!
org.junit.internal.ArrayComparisonFailure: arrays first differed at element [327680]; expected:<-36> but was:<2>

fields.summary: Decoding inputs should be correctly prepared in pread

comments.body: Thanks for filing this issue, [~eddyxu]. Looks like it happens when it chooses {{RS_6_3_LEGACY}}. I created the test in HDFS-11823. Sorry that I failed to make sure. Can I assign this jira to me?
Hello [~tasanuma0829], would you still like to work on it? Saw this test failing consecutively in precommits, so assigning the jira to you. :)
FYI https://builds.apache.org/job/hadoop-qbt-trunk-java8-linux-x86/488/testReport/
[~jojochuang] Sure, I will. Thanks for assigning it!

I found the cause of the bug. If clients do pread an ec file whose block group have some missing/corrupted blocks, {{RSLegacyRawDecoder#doDecode}} decodes blocks with not enough {{erasedOrNotToReadIndexes}}. In this case, we need to update {{erasedOrNotToReadIndexes}}. (About this failed test case, we need to update \{8\} with \{1, 2, 8\}.)

This message was automatically generated.

Hi [~tasanuma0829],

Thanks for the ping, yes I will give it a review soon. A quick question, are you using the legacy coder? Note the using of it is discouraged if there's not legacy considerations.
Thanks for the comment, [~drankye]. No, I'm not using the legacy coder.

Thanks for reviewing and the comment, [~drankye]!

> We could also compare it with the default RS coder.
{{RSRawDecoder#doDecode}} (the default RS coder) also receives unnecessary input arrays when it preads, but it does like a post fix, and decode blocks well.

> I wonder if we could get right at the first place.
I agree with you. Unlike {{StatefulStripeReader#prepareDecodeInputs()}}, {{PositionStripeReader#prepareDecodeInputs()}} seems not to generate necessary and sufficient input arrays. I will investigate it more. Thanks!

I uploaded a new patch. This patch makes {{PositionStripeReader}} generate necessary and sufficient input arrays when it decodes ec-blocks. I also checked {{TestDFSStripedInputStream#testPreadWithDNFailure()}} passed for all ec policies after applying this patch.

[~drankye], would you review it?
